titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John and James Alburtis land deeds 1977.586
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-18 18:51:41 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: John and James Alburtis land deeds
did.abstract: Two deeds for property in the town of Hempstead in Queens County owned by John and James Alburtis (spelled All Burtis in the deeds). Dated 1773 and 1814.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: These documents are very fragile and should be handled with care.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); John and James Alburtis land deeds, 1977.586, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two deeds for property in the town of Hempstead in Queens County owned by John and James Alburtis (spelled All Burtis in the deeds). Dated 1773 and 1814.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
